intro: Psoralea mephitica var. retrorsa, commonly known as the backward-facing psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can be dispersed by wind or animals. This variety is notable for its unique leaf arrangement and ecological role in its native environment.
